name: paloalto-firewall-custom
label: Palo Alto Firewall定制版
description: Palo Alto Firewall is serving as a Security Operating Platform for a long time and has been a pioneer in offering cybersecurity services. The Palo Alto Security Operating Platform makes your system and network secured from successful cyber attacks in a highly efficient and automatic way.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: IP address or Hostname of the Palo Alto Firewall
fields.name: server_url

fields.title: Virtual System
fields.tooltip: Specify the Virtual System (vsys) ID to access the Palo Alto Firewall. By default it is set as vsys1.
fields.description: Virtual System (vsys) ID to access the Palo Alto Firewall. By default, this is set as vsys1.
fields.name: virtual_sys

fields.title: Security Policy Name For Blocking IP
fields.tooltip: Security Policy Name that has been pre-configured in Palo Alto for blocking an IP.
fields.description: Security Policy Name that has been pre-configured in Palo Alto for blocking an IP.
fields.name: ip_policy_name

fields.title: IP Address Group
fields.tooltip: Name of the IP Address Group that is linked to the Security Policy Name for Blocking IP.
fields.description: Name of the IP Address Group that is linked to the Security Policy Name for Blocking IP.
fields.name: address_group

fields.title: Security Policy Name For Blocking Application
fields.tooltip: (Optional) Security Policy Name that has been pre-configured in Palo Alto for blocking an Application.
fields.description: (Optional) Security Policy Name that has been pre-configured in Palo Alto for blocking an Application.
fields.name: app_policy_name

fields.title: Application Group
fields.tooltip: (Optional) Name of the Application Group that is linked to the Security Policy Name for Blocking Application.
fields.description: (Optional) Name of the Application Group that is linked to the Security Policy Name for Blocking Application.
fields.name: app_group

fields.title: Security Policy Name For Blocking URL
fields.tooltip: (Optional) Security Policy Name that has been pre-configured in Palo Alto for blocking a URL.
fields.description: (Optional) Security Policy Name that has been pre-configured in Palo Alto for blocking a URL.
fields.name: url_policy_name

fields.title: Custom URL Group
fields.tooltip: (Optional)Name of the URL Group that is linked to the Security Policy Name for Blocking URL.
fields.description: (Optional)Name of the URL Group that is linked to the Security Policy Name for Blocking URL.
fields.name: url_group

fields.title: API Type
fields.tooltip: Select API type to execute connector actions
fields.description: Type of API that you want to use to run connector actions. You can choose between XML APIs or REST APIs. If you choose 'REST APIs', then from the Product Version field, select the PAN-OS version that will be used to perform the connector actions.
fields.name: api_type

REST APIs.title: Product Version
REST APIs.tooltip: Select the PAN-OS version to use for performing connector actions.
REST APIs.description: Select the PAN-OS version to use for performing connector actions.
REST APIs.name: version

operations.title: Create Security Policy Rule
operations.description: Creates a security policy rule in Palo Alto Firewall based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Username
parameters.description: Username to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: username

parameters.title: Password
parameters.description: Password to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: password

parameters.title: Security Policy Rule Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the security policy rule to create in Palo Alto Firewall.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: A valid security policy rule name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain zero or more alphanumeric characters, underscore "_", hyphen "-", dot "." or spaces.

parameters.title: Source Security Zone
parameters.description: Specify the source security zone of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic originating from the specified security zone. A zone is a grouping of interfaces (physical or virtual) that represents a segment of your network that is connected to, and controlled by, the firewall.
parameters.name: from
parameters.tooltip: Specify the source security zone of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic originating from the specified security zone. A zone is a grouping of interfaces (physical or virtual) that represents a segment of your network that is connected to, and controlled by, the firewall.

parameters.title: Destination Security Zone
parameters.description: Specify the destination security zone of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic destined to the specified security zone. A zone is a grouping of interfaces (physical or virtual) that represents a segment of your network that is connected to, and controlled by, the firewall.
parameters.name: to
parameters.tooltip: Specify the destination security zone of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic destined to the specified security zone. A zone is a grouping of interfaces (physical or virtual) that represents a segment of your network that is connected to, and controlled by, the firewall.

parameters.title: Source IP Address
parameters.description: Specify the source IP address of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic originating from the specified IP address.
parameters.name: source
parameters.tooltip: Specify the source IP address of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic originating from the specified IP address.

parameters.title: Destination IP Address
parameters.description: Specify the destination IP address of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic destined to the specified IP address.
parameters.name: destination
parameters.tooltip: Specify the destination IP address of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic destined to the specified IP address.

parameters.title: Service
parameters.description: Specify the service of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Default value is application-default to ensure that any application that the rule allows are allowed only on their standard ports.
parameters.name: service
parameters.tooltip: Specify the service of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Default value is application-default to ensure that any application that the rule allows are allowed only on their standard ports.

parameters.title: Application
parameters.description: Specify the application being allowed or blocked in the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Adding the application, safely enables it on the created security policy rule.
parameters.name: application
parameters.tooltip: Specify the application being allowed or blocked in the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Adding the application, safely enables it on the created security policy rule.

parameters.title: Action
parameters.description: Select the action option of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Deny, Allow, Drop, Reset Client, Reset Server, or Reset Both. By default it is set to "Allow"
parameters.name: action
parameters.tooltip: Select the action option of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Deny, Allow, Drop, Reset Client, Reset Server, or Reset Both. By default it is set to "Allow"

parameters.title: Category
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the URL Category of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. If you select a URL category, only web traffic will match the rule and only if the traffic is destined for that specified category.
parameters.name: category
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the URL Category of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. If you select a URL category, only web traffic will match the rule and only if the traffic is destined for that specified category.

parameters.title: Source User
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the users and groups to match in the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Mapped users or groups at the source of the traffic can be allowed or blocked.
parameters.name: source-user
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the users and groups to match in the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. Mapped users or groups at the source of the traffic can be allowed or blocked.

parameters.title: Rule Type
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the rule type of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Universal, Intrazone, or Interzone. By default it set to "Universal"
parameters.name: rule-type
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the rule type of the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Universal, Intrazone, or Interzone. By default it set to "Universal"

parameters.title: Disabled
parameters.description: (Optional) Select whether to disable the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Yes or No. By default it set to "No"
parameters.name: disable
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select whether to disable the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Yes or No. By default it set to "No"

parameters.title: Custom Properties
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the additional properties, in the JSON format, that you want to specify for the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the security policy rule.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the additional properties, in the JSON format, that you want to specify for the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the security policy rule.
parameters.name: attributes

operations.title: Get All Security Policy Rules List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all security policy rules or specific security policy rule from Palo Alto Firewall based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Username
parameters.description: Username to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: username

parameters.title: Password
parameters.description: Password to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: password

parameters.title: Security Policy Rule Name
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the name of the security policy rule to retrieve from Palo Alto Firewall.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the name of the security policy rule to retrieve from Palo Alto Firewall.

parameters.title: Password
parameters.description: Password to access the Palo Alto Firewall

parameters.title: Security Policy Rule Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the security policy rule to update in Palo Alto Firewall.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the security policy rule to update in Palo Alto Firewall.

parameters.title: Source Security Zone
parameters.description: Specify the source security zone of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic originating from the specified security zone. A zone is a grouping of interfaces (physical or virtual) that represents a segment of your network that is connected to, and controlled by, the firewall.

parameters.tooltip: Specify the source security zone of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic originating from the specified security zone. A zone is a grouping of interfaces (physical or virtual) that represents a segment of your network that is connected to, and controlled by, the firewall.

A zone is a grouping of interfaces (physical or virtual) that represents a segment of your network that is connected to, and controlled by, the firewall.

parameters.tooltip: Specify the destination security zone of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic destined to the specified security zone. A zone is a grouping of interfaces (physical or virtual) that represents a segment of your network that is connected to, and controlled by, the firewall.

parameters.title: Source IP Address
parameters.description: Specify the source IP address of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic originating from the specified IP address.
parameters.name: source
parameters.tooltip: Specify the source IP address of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic originating from the specified IP address.

parameters.title: Destination IP Address
parameters.description: Specify the destination IP address of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic destined to the specified IP address.
parameters.name: destination
parameters.tooltip: Specify the destination IP address of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Once specified, the Palo Alto firewall implements the rule on all traffic destined to the specified IP address.

parameters.title: Service
parameters.description: Specify the service of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall.
parameters.name: service
parameters.tooltip: Specify the service of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall.

parameters.title: Application
parameters.description: Specify the application being allowed or blocked in the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Adding the application, safely enables it on the updated security policy rule.
parameters.name: application
parameters.tooltip: Specify the application being allowed or blocked in the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Adding the application, safely enables it on the updated security policy rule.

parameters.title: Action
parameters.description: Select the action option of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Deny, Allow, Drop, Reset Client, Reset Server, or Reset Both. By default it is set to "Allow"
parameters.name: action
parameters.tooltip: Select the action option of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Deny, Allow, Drop, Reset Client, Reset Server, or Reset Both. By default it is set to "Allow"

parameters.title: Category
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the URL Category of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. If you select a URL category, only web traffic will match the rule and only if the traffic is destined for that specified category.
parameters.name: category
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the URL Category of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. If you select a URL category, only web traffic will match the rule and only if the traffic is destined for that specified category.

parameters.title: Source User
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the users and groups to match in the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Mapped users or groups at the source of the traffic can be allowed or blocked.
parameters.name: source-user
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the users and groups to match in the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. Mapped users or groups at the source of the traffic can be allowed or blocked.

parameters.title: Rule Type
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the rule type of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Universal, Intrazone, or Interzone. For example, if setting the source zone to A, B, and C and the destination zone to A and B, the rule would apply to traffic from zone A to zone B, from zone B to zone A, from zone C to zone A, and from zone C to zone B, but not traffic within zones A, B, or C. By default it set to  "Universal"
parameters.name: rule-type
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the rule type of the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Universal, Intrazone, or Interzone. By default it set to  "Universal"

parameters.title: Disabled
parameters.description: (Optional) Select whether to disable the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Yes or No. By default it set to "No"
parameters.name: disable
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select whether to disable the security policy rule being created in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Yes or No. By default it set to "No"

parameters.title: Custom Properties
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the additional properties, in the JSON format, that you want to specify for the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the security policy rule.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the additional properties, in the JSON format, that you want to specify for the security policy rule being updated in Palo Alto Firewall. The additional properties signify additional fields associated with the security policy rule.
parameters.name: attributes

operations.title: Rename Security Policy Rule
operations.description: Renames a existing security policy rule in Palo Alto Firewall based on the name of security policy rule and new name of security policy rule that you have specified.

parameters.title: Username
parameters.description: Username to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: username

parameters.title: Password
parameters.description: Password to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: password

parameters.title: Existing Security Policy Rule Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the existing security policy rule to rename in Palo Alto Firewall.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the existing security policy rule to rename in Palo Alto Firewall.

parameters.title: New Security Policy Rule Name
parameters.description: Specify the new name of the security policy rule being renamed in Palo Alto Firewall.
parameters.name: newname
parameters.tooltip: A valid new security policy rule name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain zero or more alphanumeric characters, underscore "_", hyphen "-", dot "." or spaces.

operations.title: Move Security Policy Rule
operations.description: Moves a specific security policy rule to a specified position in Palo Alto Firewall.

parameters.title: Username
parameters.description: Username to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: username

parameters.title: Password
parameters.description: Password to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: password

parameters.title: Security Policy Rule Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the security policy rule to move to a specified position in Palo Alto Firewall.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the security policy rule to move to a specified position in Palo Alto Firewall.

parameters.title: Move To
parameters.description: Select the policy position from the options to move the security policy rule in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Top, Bottom, Before, or After. By default it set to "Top"
parameters.name: where
parameters.tooltip: Select the policy position from the options to move the security policy rule in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: Top, Bottom, Before, or After. By default it set to "Top"

Before.title: Before which Rule Name
Before.description: Specify the name of the security policy rule before which to move this policy in the Before which Rule Name field.
Before.name: dst
Before.tooltip: Specify the name of the security policy rule before which to move this policy in the Before which Rule Name field.

After.title: After which Rule Name
After.description: Specify the name of the security policy rule after which to move this policy in the After which Rule Name field.
After.name: dst
After.tooltip: Specify the name of the security policy rule after which to move this policy in the After which Rule Name field.

operations.title: Delete Security Policy Rule
operations.description: Removes a specific security policy rule from Palo Alto Firewall based on the name of security policy rule that you have specified.

parameters.title: Username
parameters.description: Username to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: username

parameters.title: Password
parameters.description: Password to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: password

parameters.title: Security Policy Rule Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the security policy rule to delete from Palo Alto Firewall.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the security policy rule to delete from Palo Alto Firewall.

operations.title: Create IP Address Object
operations.description: Creates an IP address object in Palo Alto Firewall based on the name of IP address, address type, or other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Username
parameters.description: Username to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: username

parameters.title: Password
parameters.description: Password to access the Palo Alto Firewall
parameters.name: password

parameters.title: IP Address Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the IP address object to create in Palo Alto Firewall.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: A valid IP address name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain zero or more alphanumeric characters, underscore "_", hyphen "-", dot "." or spaces.

parameters.title: Address Type
parameters.description: Select the type of the address to create in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: IP Netmask, IP Range, IP Wildcard, or FQDN. By default it set to "IP Netmask"
parameters.name: address_type
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the address to create in Palo Alto Firewall. You can choose from the following options: IP Netmask, IP Range, IP Wildcard, or FQDN. By default it set to "IP Netmask"

IP Netmask.title: IP Netmask
IP Netmask.description: Specify the IP netmask to create IP address in the IP Netmask field. For example, 1.1.1.1, 1.1.1.1/1, 2001:db8:123:1::1, 2001:db8:123:1::1/64
IP Netmask.name: value
IP Netmask.tooltip: Specify the IP netmask to create IP address in the IP Netmask field. For example, 1.1.1.1, 1.1.1.1/1, 2001:db8:123:1::1, 2001:db8:123:1::1/64

IP Netmask.title: Tag
IP Netmask.description: (Optional) Specify the tag to create address object in Palo Alto Firewall. Tags on objects help group related items.
IP Netmask.name: tag
IP Netmask.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the tag to create address object in Palo Alto Firewall. Tags on objects help group related items.

IP Range.title: IP Range
IP Range.description: Specify the IP range in the IP Range field. For example 10.0.0.1-10.0.0.4, 2001:db8:123:1::1-2001:db8:123:1::11
IP Range.name: value
IP Range.tooltip: Specify the IP range in the IP Range field. For example 10.0.0.1-10.0.0.4, 2001:db8:123:1::1-2001:db8:123:1::11

IP Range.title: Tag
IP Range.description: (Optional) Specify the tag to create address object in Palo Alto Firewall. Tags on objects help group related items.
IP Range.name: tag
IP Range.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the tag to create address object in Palo Alto Firewall. Tags on objects help group related items.

IP Wildcard.title: IP Wildcard
IP Wildcard.description: Specify the IP wildcard in the IP Wildcard field. An address object of type IP Wildcard Mask can specify only IPv4 addresses and is useful if you define private IPv4 addresses to internal devices and your addressing structure assigns meaning to certain bits in the address. For e.g 10.20.1.0/0.0.248.255
IP Wildcard.name: value
IP Wildcard.tooltip: Specify the IP wildcard in the IP Wildcard field. An address object of type IP Wildcard Mask can specify only IPv4 addresses and is useful if you define private IPv4 addresses to internal devices and your addressing structure assigns meaning to certain bits in the address. For e.g 10.20.1.0/0.0.248.255

FQDN.title: FQDN
FQDN.description: Specify the FQDN in the FQDN field. An address object of type FQDN (for example, www.fortinet.com) provides further ease of use because DNS provides the FQDN resolution to the IP addresses instead of you needing to know the IP addresses and manually updating them every time the FQDN resolves to new IP addresses.
FQDN.name: value
FQDN.tooltip: Specify the FQDN in the FQDN field. An address object of type FQDN (for example, www.fortinet.com) provides further ease of use because DNS provides the FQDN resolution to the IP addresses instead of you needing to know the IP addresses and manually updating them every time the FQDN resolves to new IP addresses.

FQDN.title: Tag
FQDN.description: (Optional) Specify the tag to create address object in Palo Alto Firewall. Tags on objects help group related items.
FQDN.name: tag
FQDN.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the tag to create address object in Palo Alto Firewall. Tags on objects help group related items.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a brief description for the address object being created in Palo Alto Firewall.
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify a brief description for the address object being created in Palo Alto Firewall.

IP Netmask.description: Specify the IP netmask to update IP address in the IP Netmask field. For example, 1.1.1.1, 1.1.1.1/1, 2001:db8:123:1::1, 2001:db8:123:1::1/64

IP Netmask.tooltip: SSpecify the IP netmask to update IP address in the IP Netmask field. For example, 1.1.1.1, 1.1.1.1/1, 2001:db8:123:1::1, 2001:db8:123:1::1/64

IP Range.title: IP Range
IP Range.description: Specify the IP range in the IP Range field. For example 10.0.0.1-10.0.0.4, 2001:db8:123:1::1-2001:db8:123:1::11
IP Range.name: value
IP Range.tooltip: Specify the IP range in the IP Range field. For example 10.0.0.1-10.0.0.4, 2001:db8:123:1::1-2001:db8:123:1::11

IP Wildcard.title: IP Wildcard
IP Wildcard.description: Specify the IP wildcard in the IP Wildcard field. An address object of type IP Wildcard Mask can specify only IPv4 addresses and is useful if you define private IPv4 addresses to internal devices and your addressing structure assigns meaning to certain bits in the address.
IP Wildcard.name: value
IP Wildcard.tooltip: Specify the IP wildcard in the IP Wildcard field. An address object of type IP Wildcard Mask can specify only IPv4 addresses and is useful if you define private IPv4 addresses to internal devices and your addressing structure assigns meaning to certain bits in the address.

FQDN.title: FQDN
FQDN.description: Specify the FQDN in the FQDN field. An address object of type FQDN (for example, www.fortinet.com) provides further ease of use because DNS provides the FQDN resolution to the IP addresses instead of you needing to know the IP addresses and manually updating them every time the FQDN resolves to new IP addresses.
FQDN.name: value
FQDN.tooltip: Specify the FQDN in the FQDN field. An address object of type FQDN (for example, www.fortinet.com) provides further ease of use because DNS provides the FQDN resolution to the IP addresses instead of you needing to know the IP addresses and manually updating them every time the FQDN resolves to new IP addresses.
